responsibilities: Maintain and analyze metrics from operating systems, control planes, and applications to assist in fault detection and performance enhancement
Design, develop, and deploy tooling and systems that continually improve the reliability, scalability, and efficiency of our platform
Balance feature development speed and reliability with service-level objectives
Operate and improve our Infrastructure using industry best practices and tools
Participate in design and production readiness reviews, platform management, and capacity planning ceremonies with cross-functional teams
Document Infrastructure operations process and insights, identify repeatable actions, and automate repetitive tasks
Participate in on-call rotations, respond to incidents, and support other teams in mitigating customer-impacting events
qualifications: Ability to create production-ready code in one or more high-level languages, such as Go Lang, Python
Experience operating large-scale infrastructure in public cloud environments, such as AWS
Experience with infrastructure tooling (Terraform, Cloud Formation, Docker, Kubernetes, Ansible, Chef, Puppet)
Experience identifying nascent problems, performance bottlenecks, and areas for improvement
Ability to develop and execute plans to mitigate identified issues
analysis:
The job responsibilities and skills listed focus on infrastructure management, reliability, scalability, and efficiency of a platform. The responsibilities include maintaining and analyzing metrics, designing and deploying tooling and systems, balancing feature development with reliability, operating and improving infrastructure, participating in design and production readiness reviews, documenting processes, and participating in on-call rotations. The skills required include creating production-ready code in high-level languages, operating large-scale infrastructure in public cloud environments, and using infrastructure tooling like Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.

There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is on infrastructure and platform management, rather than developing or deploying AI models or systems that involve natural language processing or generation.
